# Question

Write a function `timezone_bumper(dt,bump)` that increases any provided timestamp by `bump::Int` hours (defaults to +3 hours). Make sure it works only for DateTime types and throws an error for Date types.

function timezone_bumper(dt::Union{Date,DateTime}, bump::Integer = 3)
    if typeof(dt) == DateTime # Check if input is a DateTime type
        return dt + Dates.Hour(bump) # Return the new timestamp with adjusted hour value
    elseif typeof(dt) == Date # Check if input is not a DateTime type (i.e., it's a Date type)
        error("Unsupported type; use only DateTime types as input for timezone_bumper function.") # Throw an error for Date types
    end
end
